intro: Montitega dealbata, commonly known as the white-flowered montitega, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its large, showy white petals and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas under the canopy of forests. Its flowers attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological significance.
